Periphs+Vars.Label: \zendperiph
Periphs+Vars.Description: End of a periph section, if you’re not starting a new periphery. Must be the only thing on the line.

Periphs+Vars.Label: \zgetperiph|id\*
Periphs+Vars.Description: Get (use) the periphery stored earlier by \periph comment|id=”preface”

Periphs+Vars.Label: \zgap[|dimen]\*
Periphs+Vars.Description: Insert a vertical gap of given dimension (6pt, 5mm, 2cm, 1.5in, etc.)

Credits+Logos.Label: \zfiga|anchor\*
Credits+Logos.Description: Insert image from piclist with given anchor

Credits+Logos.Label: \zccimg by-nd|size="size" pgpos="pgpos" scale="scale"\*
Credits+Logos.Description: Insert Create Commons logo: by, by-nc, by-nc-nd, by-nc-sa, by-nd, by-sa; pgpos=p.

Credits+Logos.Label: \zimagecopyrights[LANG]
Credits+Logos.Description: Insert image copyrights for a language

Contents.Label: \ztocbefore…\ztocbefore*
Contents.Description: Insert table rows (\tr \cat toc\cat*... ) before the TOC

Contents.Label: \ztoc[|order]\*
Contents.Description: Insert Table of Contents of given order (main, ot, nt, dc, pre, post, heb, sorta, sortb, sortc)

Contents.Label: \ztocafter …. \ztocafter*
Contents.Description: Insert table rows (\tr \tc1 …. ) after the TOC.

Contents.Label: \zthumbtab bookname
Contents.Description: Set the thumb tab text for this book (instead of using \toc3)

Pages.Label: \resetpagenums pnum
Pages.Description: Reset page numbers (negative for Roman numerals)

Pages.Label: \zNeedOddPage
Pages.Description: Insert an “empty” page if the current page is even

Pages.Label: \zNeedEvenPage
Pages.Description: Insert an “empty” page if the current page is off

Pages.Label: \zNeedQuadPage
Pages.Description: Insert 1, 2 or 3 “empty” pages if the current page is not divisible by 4

Pages.Label: \zfillsignature\*
Pages.Description: Fill a signature to the given modulo of pages. Note, uses the actual page count. Optional ‘pagenums’ parameter ‘no’=\nopagenums, ‘do’=\dopagenums), extra ensures at least this many pages will be added.

Marks+Labels.Label: \zlabel|uniquelabel\*
Marks+Labels.Description: Remember where uniquelabel is (page and reference)

Marks+Labels.Label: \zpage|uniquelabel\*
Marks+Labels.Description: Output the page number for uniquelabel

Marks+Labels.Label: \zref|id=”uniquelabel” show=”b_c:v”\*
Marks+Labels.Description: Output chapter:verse for uniquelabel (show: b=book, c=chapter, v=verse, _=space, anything else is copied)
Marks+Labels.CodeSnippet: Refer to sidebar on culture in \zref|id=”cultural_clues” show=”b_c:v”\*

Conditional.Label: \zifvarset|var="varname"\*
Conditional.Description: Sets conditional text if varname is set. emptyOK="T" ⇒ empty is true, emptyOK="F" ⇒ empty is false.

Conditional.Label: \ztruetext …\ztruetext*
Conditional.Description: Include contents if condition is true

Conditional.Label: \zfalsetext …\zfalsetext*
Conditional.Description: Include contents if condition is false

Conditional.Label: \zISBNbarcode|isbn="num" height="size" var="varid"\*
Conditional.Description: Insert ISBNbarcode for num.  Optional parameter size one of (normal, medium, short). If isbn is missing try the zvar varid

Conditional.Label: \zifhooks|marker\*
Conditional.Description: Does marker have a hook, set conditional true

Diglot.Label: \zglot|[col]\*
Diglot.Description: Use formatting for diglot column col, in a monoglot section. Return to normal formatting with \zglot|\*

Diglot.Label: \zgetperiph|side="L|R" id="preface"\*
Diglot.Description: Get (use) the appropriate L/R periphery stored earlier by \periph comment|id=”preface”

Diglot.Label: \ztoc|main[L|R]\*
Diglot.Description: Insert L/R Table of Contents of given order (main, ot, nt, dc, pre, post, heb, sorta, sortb, sortc)

Other.Label: \onebody
Other.Description: Set \BodyColumns=1 for single column body text

Other.Label: \twobody
Other.Description: Set \BodyColumns=2 for double column body text

Other.Label: \ztmon
Other.Description: Turn on TeX’s tracing macros (for debugging)

Shrink.Label: '\p' > '\p^95'
Shrink.Description: Shrink one or more paragraphs by 5% (remember to reference the PREVIOUS verse).

Stretch.Label: '\p' > '\p^103'
Stretch.Description: Stretch one or more paragraphs by 3% (remember to reference the PREVIOUS verse).

Change.Label: in '\io1 .+?\n': 'some word' > 'some\LINESEP word'
Change.Description: Find and replace WITHIN a specific context (e.g within the \io1 line, break the line between 'some' and 'word').

Change.Label: at LUK 3:10 in '\f .+?\f\*':  'Syria'  >  'Aram'
Change.Description: Location AND context specific find and replace (e.g. for the footnote found in a particular verse, change Syria to Aram)

Insert.Label: Insert a rule before \iot
Insert.Description: Insert a rule before the introductory outline. Note that you will have to translate the word 'Outline'.

Insert.Label: Insert a rule before \c 1 starts
Insert.Description: Insert a rule after the intro (for all books)

Insert.Label: Insert a page break at specific location
Insert.Description: This example demonstrates how to insert a page break at specific location within a certain book (TDX).

Insert.Label: Insert a picture
Insert.Description: Insert an illustration at a particular reference. This is NOT the best way to insert an illustration, but shows what is possible. It is better to insert the illustration in Paratext, and/or use the PicList.
Insert.CodeSnippet: at EPH 6:13 '(soldier.)' > '\1\fig A Roman soldier complete with armor|alt="Roman soldier" src="ArmorOfGodDiagram.png" size="col" ref="6:14-18"\fig*'

Insert.Label: Insert book separator pages
Insert.Description: Insert book separator pages using heading information

Format.Label: Add 3-letter book codes to headers
Format.Description: When typesetting in another script it is useful to temporarily add readable headers using the 3-letter book code. To make these generated \h1 codes to appear in the header, use the 'Book Alt (\h1)' option on the Header+Footer tab.

Format.Label: Allow linebreaks after in-word hyphens
Format.Description: This will insert a zero-width space after in-word hyphens allowing the line to break there if needed.

Format.Label: Make glossary entries list items
Format.Description:
Changes an normal paragraph \p markers to be list items \li within the Glossary.

Note that as an alternative you can use book-specific styling instead (the style 'id:GLO|p' could be added to change how \p gets styled within the Glossary).

Format.Label: Make \ior\* consistent
Format.Description: Remove the space before the \ior\* markers to make the right edge consistent in \io# lines.

Format.Label: Auto lengthen poetry
Format.Description: Short \q1 and \q2 lines work great for 2-col layouts. But for a single column layout, we can merge all \q2 into the previous \q1, and then turn every other \q1 into a \q2 to make it look like poetry.

Format.Label: Add section headers to Strong's index
Format.Description: Just for the XXS book, insert the first letter of each section of verncular renderings before the block of renderings with their Strong's H and G numbers.

Format.Label: Suppress introductory material for *some* books
Format.Description: In order to suppress the intro material (\i- markers before \c 1) in specific books (but keep it for others) replace BAK,XXA,XXE with whichever books you want the intro material stripped from.

Other.Label: Drop (remove) an illustration
Other.Description: Remove an illustration (\fig ... \fig\*) from a specific location.

Other.Label: Change \p to \nb
Other.Description: Commonly used in cases where the previous paragraph spans the chapter boundary.

Verses.Label: Show bridged verses at the start of chapters
Verses.Description: Generally people do not want to show the verse number for verse 1 at the start of a chapter. But they may want to show a bridged verse in such a situation.

Verses.Label: Paragraph Initial Verses
Verses.Description: This snippet limits verse numbers so that only the first verse in a paragraph is shown. It is typically used in conjunction with marginal verses for reader editions where only limited verse hints are required.

Verses.Label: Suppress hyphen between bridged verses
Verses.Description: When using marginal verses, if you want to suppress the hyphen that normally comes between bridged verses (so that vertical stacks don't show the hyphen) then place this code before the \bridgeVerses lines:

Verses.Label: Avoid two marginal verses crashing into each other
Verses.Description: Marginal verse numbers get printed in the margin beside the text. Sometimes, where there is a short verse, two verse numbers appear in the same line. This causes a crash between the two marginal verse numbers. One way around this is to tell the ptx macros to bridge two verses and depending on the horizontal space available may cause the verses to stack vertically.

Verses.Label: Apply rounded rectangular box to bridged verses
Verses.Description: This applies the specified rounded rectangular box (in .pdf format) to bridged verses

Hooks.Label: Set a larger space before footnote caller in the text
Hooks.Description: If the space before a footnote caller (defined by style zcf) needs to be increased, then this can be done by adding the following line.

Hooks.Label: Move the qr word up to the end of previous line (if space permits)
Hooks.Description: Used in poetry and/or song books to allow a short qr word to move up to the previous word as long as there is adequate space (defined here as 0.3em) between the end of the last word, and the qr word, like 'Selah'.

Nudges.Label: Nudge chapter number down at \nb chapters
Nudges.Description: The Burmese digit 6 rises rather high and crashes into the previous line when an \nb (no-break para) is used after a \c chapter. This snippet demonstrates how to lower the \nb chapter number by a smidgen for the given references (in this example: JHN 16, 2CO 6, HEB 6).

Nudges.Label: Forces better calculation of the number of lines
Nudges.Description: Sometimes when your apply a +1 to a reference in an AdjList, it ends up doing a +2. To prevent this unwanted behaviour, you can force a more fine-grained adjustment at the specific verse location.

Strong's.Label: Tabbed indent for glossary or Strong's index
Strong's.Description: When typesetting an indented list, such as a glossary or Strongs index, it looks neater if the main body starts at the same indent position as the rest of the paragraph. In this example, the Strongs number is in bold \bd ... \bd\* and we can add a 'tab' after the Strongs number to make things line up neatly. Note that the \setbookhook restricts this change to just the 'XXS' book.

Strong's.Label: Change Strong's numbers from the 4-digit cell into a 4-in-a-line number
Strong's.Description: The 4-digit cell numbers for Strong's cross-references are a very handy and compact form, but these are not searchable in the PDF. If you want to see the 'unpacked' version of these numbers then add a new style \\myxts which can be styled as needed and add this snippet.

Other.Label: Special page numbering for a book
Other.Description:
I need the page number for the glossary to restart numbering at one, and be prefixed with G-
First, we reset the page number to one,  and then redefine the macro that prints the pagenumber.  (`\\folio` prints lower case roman numerals if the page number is negative, and numbers starting from 1 if positive).

Other.Label: Horiz rule to fill left and right edges of \s2 titles
Other.Description: When a number of minor section headings need to stand out from the surrounding text without occupying more vertical space, using a rule which fills out from the heading to the margin on each side can be quite an elegant solution.

Other.Label: Table of Contents right-align column 2
Other.Description: It sometimes looks better if the second column on the Table of Contents is right-aligned.

Other.Label: Move colophon to after included pages
Other.Description: The first line replaces the normal colophon including code with code that will output the page. The second line puts the normal colophon including code after any included documents.

Other.Label: Technique: Setting style parameters in ptxprint-mods.tex
Other.Description: This snippet is less a snippet as a technique. It shows two ways of setting style parameters from TeX.
